gurmukhi: bHm puqR pd Awid kih eysrwsqR kih AMq ] nwm pwNs ky skl hI cIn lyhu mqvMq ]340]
transliteration: Brahm Poutra Pad Aadh Kah(i) Esraastra Kah(i) Ant|| Naam Paans Ke Sakal Hicheen Leh(u) Matvant||340||
translation: Saying firstly “Brahmputra” and then uttering “Ishvarastra”, all the names of Paash are recognized.340.

gurmukhi: bHmw Awid bKwn kY AMq pu`qR pd dyhu ] AwXuD eys bKwnIAY nwm pwNs liK lyhu ]341]
transliteration: Brahmaa Aadh Bakhaan Kai Ant Poutra Pad Deh(u)|| Aayudh Es Bakhaaneeai Naam Paans Lakh(i) Leh(u)||341||
translation: Known the names of Paash by saying firstly “Brahma” and then adding the word “Putra” and afterwards saying “Aayudh Ish”.341.

gurmukhi: bHmw Awid aucwir kY suq pd bhur bKwn ] eysrwsqR puin BwKIAY nwm pwNs pihcwn ]342]
transliteration: Brahmaa Aadh Oucdaar(i) Kai Sout Pad Bahur Bakhaan|| Esraastra Poun(i) Bhaakheeai Naam Paans Paihchaan||342||
translation: The names of Paash are recognized by uttering “Brahma” primarily and then saying the words “Sut” and “Ishrastra”.342.

gurmukhi: jgq ipqw pd piRQm kih suq pd AMq bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hY cInhu pRigAwvwn ]343]
transliteration: Jagad Pita Pad Pritham Kah(i) Sout Pad Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hai Cheenoh Pragiaavan||343||
translation: Saying primarily the words “Jagat-Pitaa” and adding the word “Sut” at the end, O talented persons ! Recognise the names of Paash.343.

gurmukhi: G`Gr Awid aucwr kY eIsrwsqR kih AMq ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cInhu pR`igAwvMq ]344]
transliteration: Ghagghar Aadh Ouchaar Kai Eesraastra Kah(i) Ant|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Cheenoh Praggiaavant||344||
translation: Naming the river Ghaggar in the beginning and uttering “Ishraastra” at the end, the names of Paash are formed, which O talented people ! you may recognize.344.

gurmukhi: Awid sursqI aucir kY eIsrwsqR kih AMq ] nwm pwNs ky skl hI cIn lyhu miqvMq ]345]
transliteration: Aadh Soutsatiouchar(i) Kai Eearaastra Kah(i) Ant|| Naam Paans Ke Sakal Hicheen Leh(u) Mat(i)vant||345||
translation: Uttering “Sarasvati” in the beginning and “Ishrastra” at the end, O talented people ! the names of Paash are formed.345.

gurmukhi: AwmU Awid bKwn kY eIsrwsqR kih AMq ] nwm skl sRI pwNs ky inksq clq ibAMq ]346]
transliteration: Aamoondaadh Bakhaan Kai Eesraastra Kah(i) Ant|| Naam Sakal Sripaans Ke Niksat Chalat Beant||346||
translation: Naming the river Amu in th beginning and uttering “Ishrastra” at the end, innumerable names of Paash continue to be evolved.346.

gurmukhi: smMd gwmnI jy ndI iqh ky nwm bKwn ] eIsrwsqR puin aucrIAY nwm pwNs pihcwn ]347]
transliteration: Samounnd Gadmanndje Naditin Ke Naam Bakhaan|| Israastra Poun(i) Ouchdarai Naam Paans Paihchaan||347||
translation: Naming all the rivers falling in the ocean and then daying “Ishrastra”, the names of Paash are known.347.

gurmukhi: skl kwl ky nwm lY AwXuD bhur bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN dIn lyhu mqvwn ]348]
transliteration: Sakal Kaal Ke Naam Lai Aayudh Bahur Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Deen Leh(u) Matvaan||348||
translation: Uttering all the names of Kaal and then adding the word “Aayudh”, the talented persons recognize all the names of Paash.348.

gurmukhi: duGt Sbd piRQmY aucir inD kih eIs bKwn ] AwXuD bhuir bKwnIAY nwm pwNs pihcwn ]349]
transliteration: Doughat Shabad Prithmai Ouchar(i) Nidh Kah(i) Ees Bakhaan|| Aayudh Bahur(i) Bakhaaneeai Naam Paans Paihchaan||349||
translation: Saying the word “Digadh” primarily and then adding “Nidhi Ish” and “Aayudh”, the names of Paash are recognized.349.

gurmukhi: pwnD piRQm bKwin kY eIsrwsqR kih AMq ] nwm skl sRI pwNs ky cInq clY AnMq ]350]
transliteration: Paanadh Pritham Bakhaan(i) Kai Eesraastra Kah(i) Ant|| Naam Sakal Sripaans Ke Cheenat Chalai Anaaat||350||
translation: Saying primarily the word “Vaaridhi” and then uttering “Ishrastra” at the end, the innumerable names of Paash are recognized.350.

gurmukhi: sRonj Awid aucwir kY inD kih eIs bKwn ] AwXuD BwXo pwNs ky inksq nwm pRmwn ]351]
transliteration: Sronaj Aadh Oucdaar(i) Kai Nidh Kah(i) Ees Bakhaan|| Aayudh Bhaakho Paans Ke Niksat Naam Pramaan||351||
translation: Saying “Shrinaj” primarily and then uttering “Nidhi Ish” and “Aayudh”, the names of Pashh continue to be evolved.351.

gurmukhi: iCqjj Awid bKwn kY eIsrwsqR kih AMq ] skl nwm sRI pwNs ky cInhu pRgXwvMq ]352]
transliteration: Chhitjaj Aadh Bakhaan Kai Eesraastra Kah(i) Ant|| Sakal Naam Sripaans Ke Cheenoh Pragyaavant||352||
translation: Saying “Kshitij” primarily and “Isharaastra” at the end, recognize all the names of Paash.352.

gurmukhi: iesqiRn Awid bKwn kY rj pd AMq aucwir ] eIsrwsqR kih pwNs ky lIjIAY nwm suDwr ]353]
transliteration: Istrin Aadh Bakhaan Kai Raj Pad Ant Oucdaar(i)|| Eesraastra Kah(i) Pans Ke Leejeeai Naam Sudhaar||353||
translation: Saying the word “Istrin” and then uttering “Ishraastra”, the names of Paah are known correctly.353.
